text:
I really wanted to like this recipe.  It was actually on the expensive side to make and it wasn't as good as I was hoping.  I followed the advice of others and added 8 ounces of cream cheese.  I think that detracted from the recipe because my dip tasted quite bland.  I also didn't roast the garlic and just added jared minced garlic.  If you're making it for the first time I would stick to the recipe and then make changes after you try it as written.  I doctored it w/o trying the original recipe and I think I would have been better off following it to the letter.  The presentation was nice, the taste was bland.

text:
Great recipes! Things I used: 15oz jar of brotolli garlic alfredo sauce, 10oz chopped spinach, 2 cups mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup parmesan cheese, 8oz cream cheese, and a sprinkle of garlic salt.Mixed everything together in a bowl,then put into dish and bake for 30 minutes.I did not use articokes can't stand them. Really do not think the taste would have be better with them. The result was great!. After taking out of the oven wait 15 minutes before eating, this gives it take to cool and thicken. I served with orginal tortilla chips. Thank you for this recipe!

text:
I made this for a party...HUGE HIT!!  I was pretty impressed with the way it turned out and everyone that ate it raved about it.  The only thing about the recipe that I didn't do was the whole "roasted garlic" bit as I decided to save some time and used minced garlic instead. However, I don't recommend it, it was a little too much garlic for me, and I LOVE garlic so that says a lot.  The next time I make it, I will omit the garlic all together because I feel the Alfredo sauce has enough garlic in it and if I feel like it needs more, I'll use garlic powder as another reviewer did.  Also, I was a little confused as to how much cream cheese was needed for this recipe; I understood half a container of an 8oz package so that's what I used and after it was finished, I felt like I could have used the whole container and it would have been just fine.  Either way, garlicky or not...the folks at the party ate it up!!!  KUDO'S TO THE CHEF WHO CREATED THIS RECIPE!!

text:
Easy and yummy! I cooked mine in a skillet instead of baking it because I was taking it to a party so I transferred it to a small-crockpot-type thing to keep dips and such warm. I also didn't roast the garlic, because I like a more strong garlic flavor, though it would be good roasted too! I just sauteed the garlic cloves and added the frozen spinach, which I covered and allowed to steam. Then I mixed in the other ingredients, the whole jar of alfredo sauce and the whole block of cream cheese. Added freshly ground black pepper and a bit of hot sauce to taste.

country:
None
text:
This recipe was pretty much amazing! We used it to make mushroom caps and it blew me away! We made it with the extra cream cheese as other reviewers did. For the mushroom caps we pressed a teaspoon into a mushroom cap, and topped each one with a cooked shrimp. We placed all the filled caps into a baking dish, and then poured herb butter over every cap with a little into the dish itself. Top with liberal amounts of shredded mozzarella cheese, and bake at 400 for 7 minutes. It was a really rich dish, but very yummy!

text:
Was a hit at a baby shower that I co-hosted for about 30 people and had no left-overs.  I doubled all the ingredients, mixed everything up, refrigerated overnight and cooked on high for 2 hours in crockpot the next day.  Omitted roasted garlic and used Bertolli Alfredo Sauce w/ Garlic and maybe 1/2 tsp of garlic/black pepper salt.  Did not thaw and drain frozen spinach either and texture still turned out fine.  Giving this recipe 4.5 stars for ease of prep and flavor.  Don't know yet if this is the "the best" recipe for this type of dip so did not give 5.  However, will definitely make again.

This turned out excellent with a few changes. I used 2 pkgs of spinach, no artichokes, 1 tsp of minced garlic instead of cloves.  I also used 16 oz of Alfredo sauce instead of 10 oz. I creamed everything together and then put in the dish to bake.  With the changes I made it turned out better than some of the restaurants we've ordered it in.

country:

text:
This was very yummy. Silly me, I forgot to chop the spinach! This made it hard to eat so try to remember to cut the spinach before mixing it in. I doubled the recipe and used 1/2 fresh spinach (10oz bag) and half frozen and 2 cans of artichokes. I also added a few tablespoons of plain yogurt, some black pepper and a few drops of Tabasco sauce. Be careful not to add any salt because it is very salty as is. Doubling the recipe made way too much, I'd stick to how it is unless you have a huge party. I garnished it with fresh diced tomatoes and lemon wedges and served it with some french bread slices and wheat thins. It was a hit!

text:
This was the first time I had ever tried making a warm spinach dip and I must say that I was impressed! I did change a few things. I used roasted garlic parm. cheese sauce, as that was the closest I found at the local grocery store! I also took some shortcuts like using about 1/2 tsp. minced garlic, approx. 1 1/2 cups of "Italian mixture"(moz.,parm.,& provolone) cheese, and a little mild cheddar.  The primary reason for using the "mixed" cheese was price.  It was cheaper to buy the bag that buy the cheeses separate.  I will make this again, it was wonderful!!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Got RAVE reviews from my friends - this is definitely my new recipe for spinach artichoke dip! I really think using alfredo sauce and cream cheese instead of mayo (which is called for in SO many of these recipes) gave the dip its "restaurant style" flavor. I basically followed the recipe, but I did not use roasted garlic - just two cloves of fresh minced garlic. I mixed all the ingredients together and spread in a pie plate to bake. Also, I used monterey jack cheese instead of mozzarella, and I ended up using about 1 1/2 cups (1/2 stirred into the dip, and 1/2 sprinkled on top). It was truly outstanding.

text:
Absolutely delish! made this dip as an appetiser for my xmas eve dinner and it was a major hit. everyone asked for the recipe.
I didn't make any changes to the recipe but i do think there are several changes i will make next time i make this.
When using larger cloves of garlic, bake a little longer to make it easier to squeeze from skins. Leave baking dish uncovered for the last 10minutes of baking to get a nice color on top =)

text:
My roommate and I have been looking for a spinach dip like the one you eat in a restaraunt,to no avail! That is until now!!! I found the recipe and made it for a new years eve party tonight. We decided to taste test it. That was the worst thing we could have done. We ate the whole thing I am embarassed to say, lol!!! I am making more for the party, but I decided to make a triple batch!!! I, like most, used a whole  brick of cream cheese and a whole jar of Bertolli alfredo cream sauce. The only thing I did differently was in the last 5 minutes of baking I added a 1/2 cup of mozzerella and parmesan cheese (mixed). I then put it back in the oven and let the cheeses get golden brown to add a nice crust on top! Delicious!  THANK YOU!!!!

text:
Though I'm certain the original recipe is delicious, I'm a somewhat-poor college student and my nearest grocery is a cheap off-brand pimping store. So, I followed some of the instructions that others have done: I used garlic alfredo sauce instead of regular alfredo + roasted garlic; The full block of cream cheese; About 3 cups of mozzarella; 4 medium-to-large artichoke hearts straight from a can; and frozen spinach, melted in a microwave and strained. After combining the ingredients I decided it was a little too salty for my taste so I added extra extra cheese. It came out wonderfully! Gooey and firm and delicious, great for dipping.

text:
This spinach artichoke dip is delicious! I made a few changes as others suggested..I added the whole block of cream cheese instead of half, and I also did not bother to roast my garlic, I just minced it. The dip was very garlicky, which could be because I didn't roast it first, so maybe I will add 3 cloves instead of 4 next time. I tried a recipe for spinach artichoke dip that did not require baking and wanted to try one that needed to be baked and I picked the right one! This was very easy and sooo good! I will make this again and again!

My guests couldn't stop talking about this!!  I actually cooked this in a crockpot and left it that way for serving.  I accompanied it with slices of french bread.  I put in extra artichokes and extra cheese too.  Based off other reviews, I used a mixture of parmesan, mozzerella, and monterey jack cheeses.  I also used a combination of Ragu Parmesan Light Alfredo sauce and Ragu Parmesan Mozerella sauce.  This was so delicious, and the perfect consistency (not too creamy, not too runny).

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Great recipe.  I used a variation of this recipe for Christmas and everyone raved about it.  The only changes I made are I used "Roasted Garlic Parmesan" sauce in place of the Alfredo, because of this, I only sprinkled a in little garlic powder  and omitted the garlic cloves.  I did not put any cheese (other than the cream cheese) into the mix (this helps the consistancy stay smooth and creamy even as the dish cools).  I did however sprinkle with Parmesan.  Also, my husband would not share the oven so I popped it into the microwave for a few minutes, till the top was bubbly, and everyone still loved it.

text:
Wonderful and easy!  I made this dip for an intimate corporate party I helped cater and it was VERY well received.  I will definitely continue to use this recipe b/c I love how the alfredo keeps it from thickening. I used another reviewer's idea of using a roasted garlic alfredo sauce (I used bertolli) in order to skip the garlic step and it made the whole thing SO easy - just throw it all in the pan and bake.

text:
This recipe is great!! It was a big hit at a get together. I did make a few changes, I used a five cheese blend instead of mozz.- which gave it a "sharper" flavor, more garlic and I also added more alfredo sauce because I like it a bit creamier than the original recipe. I do think that the alfredo is the key ingredient which gives it that great flavor compared to many other typical S/A dips.  Thanks for the great recipe!!

Excellent, excellent, excellent!  This was so yummy!  It was super easy to make, and turned out so good.  I used the suggestion to bake it covered for 30 minutes layered, stir it, and then bake it for 10-15 minutes more uncovered.  The end result was termed "better than Macaroni Grill's."  Be sure, though, that the spinach is as dry as possible, so the dip isn't mushy.

My fiance made this dish for our Valentine's Day party. It could be improved. I would bake it uncovered so the cheese would be brown instead of being mushing. And keep the artichoke cut into quarters, instead of chopping up, to preserve the artichoke flavor in the dip. Overall, it is not too bad.

text:
As everyone says, this one is a DEFINATELY keeper - I got many requests for recipes as well as requests to make it again for future functions. One thing to note, however, is that it's probably best served warm/hot... as the dip cools, it gets thicker and stiffer (I'm guessing it's because of the cream cheese in it..?) and not very "dip-friendly" as chips break off when trying to eat this cold.

text:
Good recipe.  This was a hit at a recent party.  This was a different twist to the usual artichoke dip, the alfredo sauce really gives this a nice creamy texture and a smooth taste.  However, I did have to use more cream cheese than the recipe called for, mine seemed to be somewhat runny after adding the sauce.  I will also scale back just a little on the garlic next time- four cloves was just a bit too much.  Thanks for the recipe TerraD!

text:
I just made this tonight, and it came out wonderful! I used a 16oz jar of Classico Roasted Garlic alfredo sauce, the whole 8oz block of cream cheeze, 2 cups of mozzarella, and a can of black olives, sliced. When it came out of the oven it was VERY creamy, so I let it sit and then had the most wonderful texture.
